column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=High-purity LiCoO2 was synthesized from a stoichiometric mixture of Li2CO3 99.998% and Co3O4 99.995%, which
#Text=were vacuum dried and then thoroughly ground and pelleted in an argon-filled glove box.
#Text=The pellets were heated at
#Text=850 ◦C for 4 h in air and then introduced into a glove box
#Text=while still hot after removal from the furnace at 200 ◦C.
#Text=For
#Text=the synthesis of PdCoO2, phase-pure LiCoO2, Pd 99.95%,
#Text=and PdCl2 99.999% (vacuum dried) were thoroughly mixed
#Text=in an argon-filled glovebox according to the equation Pd +
#Text=PdCl2 + 2LiCoO2 → 2PdCoO2 + 2LiCl.
#Text=The resulting powder was pressed into pellets and sealed under vacuum in a
#Text=thoroughly dried quartz ampoule with an inner quartz crucible
#Text=to help withstand attack during the synthesis.
#Text=The ampoule
#Text=was heated at 700 ◦C for 80 h with a heating and cooling
#Text=rate of 100 ◦C/h.
#Text=The LiCl2 was then removed from the product by thorough washing with hot distilled water.
#Text=Following
#Text=this, to ensure complete removal of LiCl2, the sample was washed with dilute nitric acid before final washing with water.
#Text=This process resulted in phase-pure PdCoO2 as confirmed by
#Text=Cu-Kα1 laboratory x-ray diffraction (XRD) [Fig. 2(a)].
#Text=Inductively coupled plasma and atomic absorption spectroscopy
#Text=analysis of a representative batch yielded a Pd:Co ratio of
#Text=1:1.02, further confirming the quality of the sample.
